00027 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00028 // Classes and helper functions for the extension mechanism
00029 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00030 // Helper function:
00031 inline unsigned int max_num_extensions(bool increment=false)
00032 {
00033     static unsigned int max_num = 0;
00034     if (increment) ++max_num;
00035     return max_num;
00036 }
00037 
00038 // This class can be used for storing pointers to the extension classes, used
00039 // in tlm_generic_payload:
00040 class tlm_extension_base
00041 {
00042 public:
00043     virtual tlm_extension_base* clone() const = 0;
00044     virtual ~tlm_extension_base() {}
00045 protected:
00046     static unsigned int register_extension()
00047     {
00048         return (max_num_extensions(true) - 1);
00049     };
00050 };
00051 
00052 // Base class for all extension classes, derive your extension class in
00053 // the following way:
00054 // class my_extension : public tlm_extension<my_extension> { ...
00055 // This triggers proper extension registration during C++ static
00056 // contruction time. my_extension::ID will hold the unique index in the
00057 // tlm_generic_payload::m_extensions array.
00058 template <typename T>
00059 class tlm_extension : public tlm_extension_base
00060 {
00061 public:
00062     virtual tlm_extension_base* clone() const = 0;
00063     virtual ~tlm_extension() {}
00064     const static unsigned int ID;
00065 };
00066 
00067 template <typename T>
00068 const
00069 unsigned int tlm_extension<T>::ID = tlm_extension_base::register_extension();
00070 
00071 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00072 // enumeration types
00073 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00074 enum tlm_command {
00075     TLM_READ_COMMAND,
00076     TLM_WRITE_COMMAND,
00077     TLM_IGNORE_COMMAND
00078 };
00079 
00080 enum tlm_response_status {
00081     TLM_OK_RESPONSE = 1,
00082     TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESPONSE = 0,
00083     TLM_GENERIC_ERROR_RESPONSE = -1,
00084     TLM_ADDRESS_ERROR_RESPONSE = -2,
00085     TLM_COMMAND_ERROR_RESPONSE = -3,
00086     TLM_BURST_ERROR_RESPONSE = -4,
00087     TLM_BYTE_ENABLE_ERROR_RESPONSE = -5
00088 };
00089 
00090 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00091 // The generic payload class:
00092 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00093 class tlm_generic_payload {
00094 public:
00095 
00096     //---------------
00097     // Constructors
00098     //---------------
00099     
00100     // Default constructor
00101     tlm_generic_payload() 
00102         : m_command(TLM_IGNORE_COMMAND)
00103         , m_address(0)
00104         , m_data(0)
00105         , m_length(1)
00106         , m_response_status(TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESPONSE)
00107         , m_byte_enable(0)
00108         , m_byte_enable_length(1)
00109         , m_streaming_width(0)
00110         , m_extensions(max_num_extensions())
00111         , m_dmi(false)
00112     {
00113     }
00114     
00115     // Copy constructor
00116     tlm_generic_payload(const tlm_generic_payload& x)
00117         : m_command(x.get_command())
00118         , m_address(x.get_address())
00119         , m_data(x.get_data_ptr())
00120         , m_length(x.get_data_length())
00121         , m_response_status(x.get_response_status())
00122         , m_byte_enable(x.get_byte_enable_ptr())
00123         , m_byte_enable_length(x.get_byte_enable_length())
00124         , m_streaming_width(x.get_streaming_width())
00125         , m_extensions(max_num_extensions())
00126         , m_dmi(x.get_dmi_allowed())
00127     {
00128         // copy all extensions
00129         for(unsigned int i=0; i<m_extensions.size(); i++)
00130         {
00131             m_extensions[i] = x.get_extension(i);
00132         }
00133     }
00134 
00135     // Assignment operator
00136     tlm_generic_payload& operator= (const tlm_generic_payload& x)
00137     {
00138         m_command =            x.get_command();
00139         m_address =            x.get_address();
00140         m_data =               x.get_data_ptr();
00141         m_length =             x.get_data_length();
00142         m_response_status =    x.get_response_status();
00143         m_byte_enable =        x.get_byte_enable_ptr();
00144         m_byte_enable_length = x.get_byte_enable_length();
00145         m_streaming_width =    x.get_streaming_width();
00146         m_dmi =                x.get_dmi_allowed();
00147 
00148         // extension copy: all extension arrays must be of equal size by
00149         // construction (i.e. it must either be constructed after C++
00150         // static construction time, or the resize_extensions() method must
00151         // have been called prior to using the object)
00152         for(unsigned int i=0; i<m_extensions.size(); i++)
00153         {
00154             m_extensions[i] = x.get_extension(i);
00155         }
00156         return (*this);
00157     }
00158 
00159     // non-virtual deep-copying of the object
00160     tlm_generic_payload* deep_copy() const
00161     {
00162         tlm_generic_payload* tmp = new tlm_generic_payload(*this);
00163         // deep copy data
00164         if(m_data && m_length)
00165         {
00166             unsigned char* tmp_data = new unsigned char[m_length];
00167             tmp->set_data_ptr(tmp_data);
00168             for(unsigned int i=0; i<m_length; i++)
00169             {
00170                 tmp_data[i] = m_data[i];
00171             }
00172         }
00173         // deep copy byte enables
00174         if(m_byte_enable && m_byte_enable_length)
00175         {
00176             bool* tmp_byte_enable = new bool[m_byte_enable_length];
00177             tmp->set_byte_enable_ptr(tmp_byte_enable);
00178             tmp->set_byte_enable_length(m_byte_enable_length);
00179             for (unsigned int i=0; i<m_byte_enable_length; i++)
00180             {
00181                 tmp_byte_enable[i] = m_byte_enable[i];
00182             }
00183         }
00184         // deep copy extensions
00185         for(unsigned int i=0; i<m_extensions.size(); i++)
00186         {
00187             if(m_extensions[i])
00188             {
00189                 tmp->set_extension(i, m_extensions[i]->clone());
00190             }
00191         }
00192         return tmp;
00193     }
00194 
00195     //--------------
00196     // Destructor
00197     //--------------
00198     virtual ~tlm_generic_payload() {}
00199        
00200     //----------------
00201     // API (including setters & getters)
00202     //---------------
00203 
00204     // Command related method
00205     inline bool                 is_read() {return (m_command == TLM_READ_COMMAND);}
00206     inline void                 set_read() {m_command = TLM_READ_COMMAND;}
00207     inline bool                 is_write() {return (m_command == TLM_WRITE_COMMAND);}
00208     inline void                 set_write() {m_command = TLM_WRITE_COMMAND;}
00209     inline tlm_command          get_command() const {return m_command;}
00210     inline void                 set_command(const tlm_command command) {m_command = command;}
00211     
00212     // Address related methods
00213     inline sc_dt::uint64        get_address() const {return m_address;}
00214     inline void                 set_address(const sc_dt::uint64 address) {m_address = address;}
00215     
00216     // Data related methods
00217     inline unsigned char*       get_data_ptr() const {return m_data;}
00218     inline void                 set_data_ptr(unsigned char* data) {m_data = data;}
00219     
00220     // Transaction length (in bytes) related methods
00221     inline unsigned int         get_data_length() const {return m_length;}
00222     inline void                 set_data_length(const unsigned int length) {m_length = length;}
00223     
00224     // Response status related methods
00225     inline bool                 is_response_ok() {return (m_response_status > 0);}
00226     inline bool                 is_response_error() {return (m_response_status <= 0);}
00227     inline tlm_response_status  get_response_status() const {return m_response_status;}
00228     inline void                 set_response_status(const tlm_response_status response_status)
00229         {m_response_status = response_status;}  
00230     inline std::string          get_response_string()
00231     {
00232         switch(m_response_status)
00233         {
00234         case TLM_OK_RESPONSE:            return "TLM_OK_RESPONSE"; break;
00235         case TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESPONSE:    return "TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESPONSE"; break;
00236         case TLM_GENERIC_ERROR_RESPONSE: return "TLM_GENERIC_ERROR_RESPONSE"; break;
00237         case TLM_ADDRESS_ERROR_RESPONSE: return "TLM_ADDRESS_ERROR_RESPONSE"; break;
00238         case TLM_COMMAND_ERROR_RESPONSE: return "TLM_COMMAND_ERROR_RESPONSE"; break;
00239         case TLM_BURST_ERROR_RESPONSE:   return "TLM_BURST_ERROR_RESPONSE"; break;
00240         case TLM_BYTE_ENABLE_ERROR_RESPONSE: return "TLM_BYTE_ENABLE_ERROR_RESPONSE"; break;    
00241         }
00242         return "TLM_UNKNOWN_RESPONSE";
00243     }
00244     
00245     // Streaming related methods
00246     inline unsigned int         get_streaming_width() const {return m_streaming_width;}
00247     inline void                 set_streaming_width(const unsigned int streaming_width) {m_streaming_width = streaming_width; }
00248         
00249     // Byte enable related methods
00250     inline bool*                get_byte_enable_ptr() const {return m_byte_enable;}
00251     inline void                 set_byte_enable_ptr(bool* byte_enable){m_byte_enable = byte_enable;}
00252     inline unsigned int         get_byte_enable_length() const {return m_byte_enable_length;}
00253     inline void                 set_byte_enable_length(const unsigned int byte_enable_length){m_byte_enable_length = byte_enable_length;}
00254     
00255     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00256     /* Generic Payload attributes:                                           */
00257     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00258     /* - m_command         : Type of transaction. Three values supported:    */
00259     /*                       - TLM_WRITE_COMMAND                             */
00260     /*                       - TLM_READ_COMMAND                              */
00261     /*                       - TLM_IGNORE_COMMAND                            */
00262     /* - m_address         : Transaction base address (byte-addressing).     */
00263     /* - m_data            : When m_command = TLM_WRITE_COMMAND contains a   */
00264     /*                       pointer to the data to be written in the target.*/
00265     /*                       When m_command = TLM_READ_COMMAND contains a    */
00266     /*                       pointer where to copy the data read from the    */
00267     /*                       target.                                         */
00268     /* - m_length          : Total number of bytes of the transaction.       */
00269     /* - m_response_status : This attribute indicates whether an error has   */
00270     /*                       occurred during the transaction.                */
00271     /*                       Values supported are:                           */
00272     /*                       - TLM_OK_RESP                                   */
00273     /*                       - TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESP                           */
00274     /*                       - TLM_GENERIC_ERROR_RESP                        */
00275     /*                       - TLM_ADDRESS_ERROR_RESP                        */
00276     /*                       - TLM_COMMAND_ERROR_RESP                        */
00277     /*                       - TLM_BURST_ERROR_RESP                          */
00278     /*                       - TLM_BYTE_ENABLE_ERROR_RESP                    */
00279     /*                                                                       */
00280     /* - m_byte_enable     : It can be used to create burst transfers where  */
00281     /*                    the address increment between each beat is greater */
00282     /*                    than the word length of each beat, or to place     */
00283         /*                    words in selected byte lanes of a bus.             */
00284     /* - m_byte_enable_length : For a read or a write command, the target    */
00285     /*                    interpret the byte enable length attribute as the  */
00286     /*                    number of elements in the bytes enable array.      */
00287     /* - m_streaming_width  :                                                */
00288     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00289 
00290 private:
00291         
00292     tlm_command          m_command;
00293     sc_dt::uint64        m_address;                     
00294     unsigned char*       m_data;
00295     unsigned int         m_length;              
00296     tlm_response_status  m_response_status;
00297     bool*                m_byte_enable;
00298     unsigned int         m_byte_enable_length;
00299     unsigned int         m_streaming_width;
00300     
00301 public:
00302    
00303     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00304     /* Dynamic extension mechanism:                                          */
00305     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00306     /* The extension mechanism is intended to enable initiator modules to    */
00307     /* optionally and transparently add data fields to the                   */
00308     /* tlm_generic_payload. Target modules are free to check for extensions  */
00309     /* and may or may not react to the data in the extension fields. The     */
00310     /* definition of the extensions' semantics is solely in the              */
00311     /* responsibility of the user.                                           */
00312     /*                                                                       */
00313     /* The following rules apply:                                            */
00314     /*                                                                       */
00315     /* - Every extension class must be derived from tlm_extension, e.g.:     */
00316     /*     class my_extension : public tlm_extension<my_extension> { ... }   */
00317     /*                                                                       */
00318     /* - A tlm_generic_payload object should be constructed after C++        */
00319     /*   static initialization time. This way it is guaranteed that the      */
00320     /*   extension array is of sufficient size to hold all possible          */
00321     /*   extensions. Alternatively, the initiator module can enforce a valid */
00322     /*   extension array size by calling the resize_extensions() method      */
00323     /*   once before the first transaction with the payload object is        */
00324     /*   initiated.                                                          */
00325     /*                                                                       */
00326     /* - Initiators should use the the set_extension(e) or clear_extension(e)*/
00327     /*   methods for manipulating the extension array. The type of the       */
00328     /*   argument must be a pointer to the specific registered extension     */
00329     /*   type (my_extension in the above example) and is used to             */
00330     /*   automatically locate the appropriate index in the array.            */
00331     /*                                                                       */
00332     /* - Targets can check for a specific extension by calling               */
00333     /*   get_extension(e). e will point to zero if the extension is not      */
00334     /*   present.                                                            */
00335     /*                                                                       */
00336     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00337 
00338     // Stick the pointer to an extension into the vector, return the
00339     // previous value:
00340     template <typename T> T* set_extension(T* ext)
00341     {
00342         resize_extensions();
00343         T* tmp = static_cast<T*>(m_extensions[T::ID]);
00344         m_extensions[T::ID] = static_cast<tlm_extension_base*>(ext);
00345         return tmp;
00346     }
00347     // non-templatized version with manual index:
00348     tlm_extension_base* set_extension(unsigned int index,
00349                                       tlm_extension_base* ext)
00350     {
00351         resize_extensions();
00352         tlm_extension_base* tmp = m_extensions[index];
00353         m_extensions[index] = ext;
00354         return tmp;
00355     }
00356 
00357     // Check for an extension, ext will point to 0 if not present
00358     template <typename T> void get_extension(T*& ext) const
00359     {
00360         ext = static_cast<T*>(m_extensions[T::ID]);
00361     }
00362     // Non-templatized version:
00363      tlm_extension_base* get_extension(unsigned int index) const
00364     {
00365         return m_extensions[index];
00366     }
00367 
00368     // Clear extension, the argument is needed to find the right index:
00369     template <typename T> void clear_extension(const T* ext)
00370     {
00371         resize_extensions();
00372         m_extensions[T::ID] = static_cast<tlm_extension_base*>(0);
00373     }
00374     // Non-templatized version with manual index
00375     void clear_extension(unsigned int index)
00376     {
00377         if (index < m_extensions.size())
00378         {
00379             m_extensions[index] = static_cast<tlm_extension_base*>(0);
00380         }
00381     }
00382 
00383     // Make sure the extension array is large enough. Can be called once by
00384     // an initiator module (before issuing the first transaction) to make
00385     // sure that the extension array is of correct size. This is only needed
00386     // if the initiator cannot guarantee that the generic payload object is
00387     // allocated after C++ static construction time.
00388     void resize_extensions()
00389     {
00390         m_extensions.expand(max_num_extensions());
00391     }
00392 
00393 private:
00394     tlm_array<tlm_extension_base*> m_extensions;
00395 
00396 public:
00397   // This is the "DMI-hint" a slave can set this to true if it
00398   // wants to indicate that a DMI request would be supported:
00399   void set_dmi_allowed(bool dmiAllowed) { m_dmi = dmiAllowed; }
00400   bool get_dmi_allowed() const { return m_dmi; }
00401 
00402 private:
00403   bool m_dmi;
00404 };
00405 
00406 } // namespace tlm
